intro: Petiveria graveolens, commonly known as copal tree or copal, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
